summary: The Monarch Action, Recovery, and Conservation of Habitat Act of 2025 (MONARCH Act) aims to conserve and sustain the western monarch butterfly population. The bill establishes the Western Monarch Butterfly Rescue Fund to provide grants for conservation projects, defines key terms, and outlines criteria for project approval. It directs the Secretary of the Interior to provide technical assistance, require project reporting, and enter into an agreement with the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation to implement the Western Monarch Butterfly Conservation Plan. The bill authorizes appropriations for the fund and plan implementation and mandates an annual report to Congress on the status of the butterflies and funded projects.
